paper.title: Therapist-Robot-Patient Physical Interaction is Worth a Thousand Words: Enabling Intuitive Therapist Guidance via Remote Haptic Control
paper.abstract: Abstract:Robotic systems can enhance the amount and repeatability of physically guided motor training. Yet their real-world adoption is limited, partly due to non-intuitive trainer/therapist-trainee/patient interactions. To address this gap, we present a haptic teleoperation system for trainers to remotely guide and monitor the movements of a trainee wearing an arm exoskeleton. memory_insight.before_after_comparisons: The system reduced movement completion time by 15.6% and improved smoothness by 12.5% compared to conventional visual demonstration.

analysis.engineering_takeaway: The haptic demonstration system can be effectively used for remote human-robot physical interaction, reducing movement completion time and improving smoothness.
technical_details: Virtual contact points at the exoskeleton's elbow and wrist
Large language models for automated transcription and categorization of verbal commands
analysis.deployment_feasibility: Yes, the system can be deployed on both mobile and laptop devices, as it does not require high-end hardware acceleration or large memory capacity.

review_questions: Is this genuinely a breakthrough? Or incremental improvement?
